article_title: Deutsche Bahn to Invest $467 Million in Trains, Die Welt Says
article_text: SHARE THIS ARTICLE   Share   Tweet   Post   Email  {"contentId":"LEVM241A74E901","position":"brokerboxarticle","dimensions":{"large_desktop":[[120,60]],"small_desktop":[[120,60]],"tablet":[[120,60]]},"strategy":"viewable","positionIncrement":1,"targeting":{"position":"brokerboxarticle1","url":"/news/articles/2011-01-12/deutsche-bahn-to-invest-467-million-in-trains-die-welt-says"},"containerId":"brokerboxarticle-SQB9AZ1"}   Deutsche Bahn AG will invest 360 million euros ($467 million) in long-distance trains to modernize its fleet, Die Welt reported, citing unidentified people at the company.    The railway ordered 27 double-deck trains from Bombardier Inc., which will be ready for use in December 2013, the newspaper said in a preview of an article to appear in today’s edition.     Published on ‎12‎ ‎January‎, ‎2011‎ ‎05‎:‎01        Have a confidential tip for our reporters? GET IN TOUCH    Before it's here, it's on the Bloomberg Terminal.
